column4: Even with Drag & Drop sudo permissions is still denied. https://help.ubuntu.com/community/RootSudo#Drag%20&%20Drop%20sudo
How can an attacker know the username behind a router and firewall on a private intranet?
I tried to ssh within root   <root>@<hostname>  permissions is still denied.
All I want to do is to copy and paste with a ssh gui to /usr/share/apache2/default-site/
User permission is denied.
Root permission is denied.
What is the sudo command for that?
What I am doing is working with 192.168.0.*** to SSH into Kubuntu box. I can see every file and directory but cannot copy and paste from Windows to Kubuntu.
What are you trying to copy and paste from Windows to Kubuntu?
What client are you using on Windows?
my simplest suggestion, copy as a regular user, use the terminal and sudo to copy as a root to your required directory
How comfortable are you with the terminal?
no no, I meant executing terminal commands. For example, if I told you do a "sudo mv /home/Curly_Q/copied_stuff /usr/share/apache2/default-site/" would you understand?
Because by default no user has permissions to login remotely to add files into /usr/share
Somehow I don't think that's going to help you. Your default account is already allowed sudo permissions, so I doubt adding it to sudoers is going to help you
If you login directly as root, you do have permissions to write into any folder
What exactly do you mean "gui copy and paste" .. What GUI are you using exactly?
There's something still missing in your description. Somehow I doubt it's a permissions problem
SSH Tectia is the SCP client you are using, correct?

May I offer a suggestion? I went to SSH Tectia's website, and it doesn't seem to be free. Download WinSCP, http://winscp.net/eng/download.php use it to login as root (and not as user) to your Linux machine .. you should see 2 file system trees side by side

ah well .. just that I use winscp and I don't seem to have a problem transferring files as root to my Ubuntu box .. I don't know how Tectia works, so I can't really provide any good troubleshooting options
If Tectia was free, I would have tried to install it and seen how it is .. as it is not I really can't do anything other than suggest a free alternative
Well all I can say is give the portable WinSCP, you won't have to install anything
err I meant give the portable WinSCP a try .. it has a very intuitive user interface too
